noun.description: A meat, seafood, or vegetable dish that accompanies rice in a typical Filipino meal.
examples: a sumptuous lunch of rice and two viands
Filipinos on a tight budget prioritize rice over viand

origin: Late Middle English: from Old French viande food, from an alteration of Latin vivenda, neuter plural gerundive of vivere to live; viand (sense 2) has been adopted in Philippine English as a translation of the Tagalog word ulam.
